ForwardDistanceReward: Measures the change in the x-coordinate of the robot's torso, indicating forward movement. The more positive the value, the more forward distance the robot has traveled.
ProgressTowardsGoalReward: Measures progress towards a goal by the change in x-coordinate. The more positive the value, the more progress made towards the goal.
HealthyZPositionCount: Checks if the z-coordinate of the robot is within a healthy range. 0 indicates the robot is not healthy, 1 indicates the robot is healthy.
TotalTorqueExerted: Calculates the total torque exerted by the robot's joints. The more positive the value, the more torque is being exerted, indicating higher energy consumption.
MeanJointAngularVelocities: Averages the absolute values of the joint angular velocities, indicating joint activity. The more positive the value, the more active the joints are.
TorqueApplicationFrequency: Measures the frequency of torque application across joints. The more positive the value, the more frequently torque is being applied.
MaxJointAngleDeviation: Calculates the maximum deviation of joint angles from expected positions. The more positive the value, the greater the deviation from expected joint positions.
TrajectoryChangeCount: Measures significant changes in the robot's trajectory based on distance moved. The more positive the value, the more significant the changes in trajectory.
OrientationStability: Tracks changes in the robot's orientation angles to assess stability. The more negative the value, the less stable the robot's orientation is.
JointPerformanceIndex: Calculates a performance index based on the ratio of angular velocities to torque exerted. The more positive the value, the more efficient the joint performance.
MovementOscillationCount: Measures oscillations in movement patterns based on distance moved. The more positive the value, the more oscillatory the movement is.
